newsitem.title: USA: US late spot LPGs narrowly mixed in sleepy trade.
newsitem.headline: US late spot LPGs narrowly mixed in sleepy trade.

text.p: Spot LPG prices were narrowly mixed in lethargic activity late Thursday, with traders saying stronger NYMEX crude prevented kept propane on a fairly even keel.
Mont Belvieu propane was pegged at between 38.75 and 39.00 cents a gallon, 0.25 cent weaker than Wednesday, with Conway material unchanged at 38.25/38.50 cents.
"It would have been weaker if it wasn't for NYMEX," one Houston LPG trader said. "Most shorts already covered earlier this week for August, so a lot of the prompt demand has been spent," he added.
Belvieu normal butane, meanwhile, slipped a half cent to 46.75/47.25 cents, players said. Conway material was sold for 44.87 cents, a touch lower, they added.
